data.event: Chandler bought Sylvester’s Farm in 1822, from Thomas Sylvester who had been granted the land about ten years earlier.

event.title: had been granted the land about ten years earlier

data.event: Chandler bought Sylvester’s Farm in 1822, from Thomas Sylvester who had been granted the land about ten years earlier.

event.title: That year he was also granted

data.event: That year he was also granted 1,200 acres (490 ha) of land which stretched from what is now Bexley North to most of Rockdale and Kogarah.
That year he was also granted 1,200 acres (490 ha) of land which stretched from what is now Bexley North to most of Rockdale and Kogarah.
The estate was heavily timbered and a track through the centre, used by timber-getters, is today called Forest Road.

event.title: sold the land to Charles Thompson in 1836

data.event: Chandler was not happy with his ill-assortment of neighbours and sold the land to Charles Thompson in 1836.
